question: Is there any protein that undergoes both mono-ubiquitination and poly-ubiquitination?
ideal_answer: Yes, there are some rare cases where a protein can be both mono-ubiquitinated and poly-ubiquitinated.

snippets.text: The yeast G protein alpha subunit Gpa1 represents a rare example of a protein that undergoes both mono- and poly-ubiquitination.

Although the biological relevance of this mono-ubiquitination was not defined, the function of Ro52 might be modified by the mono-ubiquitination.
